result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Cherry Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert J Cherry Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert J Cherry Jr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court has colloquy with DE in regards to competency. DE believes he is competent. Attorney Gonzalez and ADA Davis are in agreement with competency finding. Exhibit 1 marked and received. Court finds DE competent to proceed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

for competency exam
Zoom
Status conference on March 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DAT or DMT. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 3300 block of Leopold Way in Fitchburg. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

02:24 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
